DataElement.preferredName: Lesion Substance Morphology Necrosis Proportion Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Visually, when scanning through the entire tumor volume, the proportion of the tumor taht is estimated to represent necrosis. Necrosis is defined as a region within the tumor that does not enhance, is high on T2W and proton density images, is low on T1W images, and has an irregular border.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part._A material with particular features._Morphology is the form and structure of organisms (plants, animals, and other forms of life), or of their parts, and the study or science of the same._The pathologic localized death of living cells, as from infection or interruption of the blood supply, generally associated with severe cellular trauma caused by progressive degradation by enzymes. Characterized by mitochondrial swelling, nuclear flocculation, and uncontrolled cell lysis, it is unprogrammed death of living tissue and cells._A part, fraction, share, or number considered in relation to the whole amount or number.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: (LEE-zhun) An area of abnormal tissue change.:A material with particular features.:Morphology is the form and structure of organisms (plants, animals, and other forms of life), or of their parts, and the study or science of the same.

Concepts.definition: A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part.
Any matter of defined composition that has discrete existence, whose origin may be biological, mineral or chemical.

The science of the form and structure of organisms (plants, animals, and other forms of life), or of their parts, and the study or science of the same.  In pathology, the specific appearance of cells and tissues (normal and abnormal) under the light or electron microscope.

Property.preferredDefinition: The pathologic localized death of living cells, as from infection or interruption of the blood supply, generally associated with severe cellular trauma caused by progressive degradation by enzymes. Characterized by mitochondrial swelling, nuclear flocculation, and uncontrolled cell lysis, it is unprogrammed death of living tissue and cells.:A part, fraction, share, or number considered in relation to the whole amount or number.

Concepts.definition: A cell death process that is morphologically characterized by a gain in cell volume (oncosis), swelling of organelles, plasma membrane rupture and subsequent loss of intracellular contents.
A part, fraction, share, or number considered in relation to the whole amount or number.

ReferenceDocuments.description: What proportion of the entire tumor is Necrosis?
